<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">On January&nbsp;5, 2015, the Company entered into an 
agreement to acquire a 100% interest in the Vogel property, located contiguous 
to the Bell Creek Mine, for $654; the agreement closed on March&nbsp;3, 2015.
Previously the Company had a mining lease on the property and was paying an 
advance royalty.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the first quarter of 2015, the Company issued 
50,000 common shares to certain First Nation communities, under an Impact and 
Benefits Agreement, valued at $56 and capitalized in mining 
interests.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">The depreciation of plant and equipment utilized in 
capital development is capitalized ($204 and $545, respectively for the three 
and six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2015; $306 and $651, respectively for same 
periods in 2014).</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New 
Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Exploration 
Spending</font></i></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">Exploration and evaluation of $6,827 and $11,981, 
respectively for the three and six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2015, includes 
$6,571 and $11,447, respectively, on drilling and other exploration work at the 
144 property ($213 and $447 for the same periods in 2014, respectively, with 
$Nil spending at the 144 property in both periods).</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-
indent:-.25in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">9.</font></b><font size="1" style="font-
size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&
#160;&#160; </font><b>LONG TERM DEBT</b></p>

style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

THE THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2015 AND 2014</font></b></p>

<td width="64%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:64.04%;">

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">$</font></b></p>    </td>
<td width="11%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double 
windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:11.26%;">
<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><b><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-
weight:bold;">92,084</font></b></p>    </td>
<td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.58%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>    </td>
<td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double 
windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.16%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>    </td>
<td width="16%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double 
windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:16.22%;">
<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2"
face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">89,708</font></p>    </td>
<td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:.98%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>    </td>   </tr>  </table>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">In September&nbsp;2012, the Company issued 103,500 at 
$1.0 of Convertible Unsecured Debentures (the &#147;Debentures&#148;) for an 
aggregate principal amount of $103,500 which bears annual interest at 6.25%, 
payable semi-annually in arrears on March&nbsp;31 and September&nbsp;30 of each 
year, starting on March&nbsp;31, 2013, and maturing on September&nbsp;30, 
2017.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Debenture holders may convert the Debentures at 
their option at any time prior to the maturity date. The Debentures are 
convertible into common shares of the Company at a conversion rate of 714.2857 
common shares for every $1.0 amount principal of the Debentures, subject to 
adjustment in certain events.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Debentures are redeemable in cash or in the 
Company&#146;s shares starting from September&nbsp;30, 2015 provided the volume 
weighted average price of the Company&#146;s shares on the TSX for 20 
consecutive trading days ending five days prior to the date on which notice of 
redemption is given (the &#147;current market price&#148;) is at least $1.82 per
common share. The number of shares to be issued will be determined by dividing 
the principal amount of Debentures to be redeemed by 95% of the current market 
price.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company may purchase the Debentures in the market 
at any time, subject to regulatory requirements.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">The option of the holders to convert the Debentures 
into common shares of the Company resulted in the Debentures being accounted for
as a compound financial instrument with $82,512 recorded at inception as long 
term debt and $20,988 as equity (the latter representing the value of the holder
conversion option). The debt component is subsequently measured at amortized
cost using the effective interest rate method.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-
indent:-.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">(b)</font></i><i><font size="1" style="font-
size:3.0pt;font-style:italic;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; 
</font>Sprott Resource Lending Partnership Credit Facility</i></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">On June&nbsp;14, 2012, the Company signed a financing 
agreement (&#147;Initial Agreement&#148;) with Sprott Resource Lending 
Partnership (&#147;Sprott&#148;) for a credit facility (the 
&#147;Facility&#148;) totaling up to $70,000, secured by the material assets of 
the Company. The Facility involved two components: a $35,000 gold loan (the 
&#147;Gold Loan&#148;), payable monthly starting on January&nbsp;31, 2013 to 
May&nbsp;31, 2015; and, a standby line of credit (the &#147;Standby Line&#148;) 
for an additional $35,000. The transaction closed on July&nbsp;16, 2012, at 
which time the Company received $35,000 for the Gold Loan. The Standby Line of 
$35,000 was fully drawn on February&nbsp;1, 2013. The annual interest rate for 
the Standby Line was 9.75% compounded monthly.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">On December&nbsp;12, 2013, the Company entered into a 
modification agreement (the &#147;Modification Agreement&#148;) with Sprott 
whereby the Company agreed to repay the Standby Line through 18 equal monthly 
payments starting on June&nbsp;30, 2015 with the final payment due on 
November&nbsp;30, 2016; previously, the Standby Line was due in full on 
January&nbsp;1, 2015.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-
align:center;">8<a name="PB_8_151118_5335"></a></p>
<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade 
align="left" style="color:#010101;"></div>
</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='8',FILE='C:\JMS\105568\15-16617-1\task7517244\16617-1-mo-
07.htm',USER='105568',CD='Jul 31 02:49 2015' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-
align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">LAKE SHORE GOLD CORP</font></b>.</p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">NOTES
TO THE CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED INTERIM FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</font></b></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">FOR 
THE THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2015 AND 2014</font></b></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><i><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">(in 
thousands of Canadian dollars, except&#160; for share information and per share 
amounts, unaudited)</font></i></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Gold Loan was repaid through monthly cash payments
based on 947 ounces of gold each month multiplied by the Bloomberg gold closing 
price on the date of payment, with the last payment made on May&nbsp;29, 2015.
The Standby Line was fully repaid as at December&nbsp;31, 2014.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Sprott debt facility had certain financial 
covenants, as disclosed in note 17 of the Company&#146;s annual consolidated 
financial statements. The Company was in full compliance with all debt covenants
throughout the period from January&nbsp;1, 2015 through the date of the last 
payment, May&nbsp;29, 2015 and throughout the year ended December&nbsp;31, 
2014.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-
indent:-.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">(i)</font></i><i><font size="1" style="font-
size:3.0pt;font-
style:italic;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160
; </font>Gold Loan</i></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF"

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">$</font></b></p>    </td>
<td width="11%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" 
style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 
2.25pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:11.26%;">
<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><b><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-
weight:bold;">&#151;</font></b></p>    </td>
<td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" 
style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.58%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>    </td>
<td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" 
style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 
2.25pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.16%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>    </td>
<td width="17%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" 
style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 
2.25pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:17.46%;">
<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2"
face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#151;</font></p>    </td>
<td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" 
style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.04%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>    </td>   </tr>  </table>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">As a result of the indexation of the principal 
repayments to the movement in the price of gold, the Gold Loan contained a 
derivative which was embedded in the Canadian dollar denominated debt instrument
(the &#147;Embedded Derivative&#148;). The Embedded Derivative was marked to 
market at each period end with changes in fair value recorded as other income 
(loss) and foreign exchange gain (loss), the latter representing the impact of 
changes in the US$/Canadian$ exchange rate on the fair value of the 
derivative.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Modification Agreement provided for the minimum 
return (the &#147;floor&#148;) on the Gold Loan to increase to 7.5% (from 5% 
under the original agreement); the minimum return provision was considered a 
derivative embedded in the Gold Loan (the &#147;Minimum Return Derivative&#148;)
due to the floor being in the money at the time of the modification. The Minimum
Return Derivative was equivalent to the additional amount (if any) the Company 
would have to pay at the maturity of the Gold Loan to ensure the return to 
Sprott was at least 7.5%; the derivative was marked to market at each period end
with changes in fair value recorded as unrealized derivative gain (loss). At 
May&nbsp;29, 2015 (the last payment on the Gold Loan), the Company paid $92 for 
the Minimum Return Derivative.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-
align:center;">9<a name="PB_9_151222_5796"></a></p>
<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade 
align="left" style="color:#010101;"></div>

<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-
align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">LAKE SHORE GOLD CORP</font></b>.</p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">NOTES
TO THE CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED INTERIM FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</font></b></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">FOR 
THE THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2015 AND 2014</font></b></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><i><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">(in 
thousands of Canadian dollars, except&#160; for share information and per share 
amounts, unaudited)</font></i></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">Gold Loan changes for three and six months ended 
June&nbsp;30, 2015 and 2014 were as follows:</font></p>

style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

months ended June&nbsp;30, 2015 and 2014 were as follows:</font></p>

style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0.375pt 0in;width:.76%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>    </td>   </tr>
<tr>

loss</font></p>    </td>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-
indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">(ii)</font><font size="1" style="font-
size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; 
</font>Standby Line</p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">As at December&nbsp;31, 2014, the Standby Line was 
fully repaid with $5,000 paid in December&nbsp;2013 and the remaining balance of
$30,000 paid in 2014, the latter including $10,000 on June&nbsp;4 without 
penalty and $20,000 on December&nbsp;31 together with a 6% prepayment fee 
($1,200) and a 1% rollover fee ($200) as provided in the Modification Agreement.
$3,356 of unamortized transaction costs were written off as at </font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-
align:center;">10<a name="PB_10_152030_2897"></a></p>
<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade 
align="left" style="color:#010101;"></div>
</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='10',FILE='C:\JMS\105568\15-16617-1\task7517244\16617-1-mo-
07.htm',USER='105568',CD='Jul 31 02:49 2015' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-
align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">LAKE SHORE GOLD CORP</font></b>.</p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">NOTES
TO THE CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED INTERIM FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</font></b></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">FOR 
THE THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2015 AND 2014</font></b></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><i><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">(in 
thousands of Canadian dollars, except&#160; for share information and per share 
amounts, unaudited)</font></i></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">December&nbsp;31, 2014 ($964 for the three and six 
months ended June&nbsp;30, 2014 related to the prepayment on 
June&nbsp;4).</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the three and six months ended June&nbsp;30, 
2015 the Company incurred $Nil of interest expense and unwinding of discount 
related to the Standby Line (same periods in 2014 - $1,132 and $2,352, 
respectively), and paid $Nil in respect of interest expense (same periods in 
2014 - $1,400 and $3,157, respectively).</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-
indent:-.25in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">10.</font></b><font size="1" style="font-
size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><b>EQUITY</b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><b><font size="2"
face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">a)&#160;&#160;
Share capital</font></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">In 2014, the Company raised gross proceeds of $20,128 
by issuing flow through common shares under two private placements (5,300,000 
flow through common shares at $0.95 per flow through share issued in 
May&nbsp;2014 and 12,900,000 flow through common shares at $1.17 per flow 
through share issued in December&nbsp;2014). The net proceeds from the flow 
through financings of $19,310 were recorded as share capital ($15,652) and 
deferred premium liability ($3,658). The Company has until December&nbsp;31, 
2015 to spend the flow through funds raised in 2014 on eligible Canadian 
exploration expenditures (&#147;CEE&#148;). The Company has spent $11,398 on CEE
to June&nbsp;30, 2015 ($2,980 to December&nbsp;31, 2014).</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the three and six months ended June&nbsp;30, 
2015, the Company amortized $1,192 and $2,072 (same periods in 2014 - $Nil) of 
deferred premium (recorded in other income (loss)).</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><b><font size="2" 
face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">b)&#160;&#160;
Reserves</font></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-
indent:-.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">i)</font></i><i><font size="1" style="font-
size:3.0pt;font-
style:italic;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160
;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Share Options</i></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">As at June&nbsp;30, 2015, the Company had 19,963,727 
options outstanding of which 11,095,393 are exercisable. Movements in share 
options during the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2015 and 2014 were as 
follows:</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="96%" style="border-
collapse:collapse;margin-left:.25in;">
<tr>
<td width="34%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:34.84%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>    </td>
<td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.6%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font 
size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-
weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>    </td>
<td width="27%" colspan="4" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-
bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:27.42%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font 
size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-
weight:bold;">June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2015</font></b></p>    </td>
<td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.58%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font 
size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-
weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>    </td>
<td width="31%" colspan="4" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-
bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:31.54%;">

<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2"
face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">11,231,000</font></p>    </td>
<td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.58%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>    </td>
<td width="15%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-
bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:15.44%;">
<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2"
face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>    </td>
<td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.02%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>    </td>   </tr>  </table>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-
indent:-.25in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">ii)</font></i><i><font size="1" style="font-
size:3.0pt;font-
style:italic;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160
; </font>Share based payment expense</i></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">Share based payment expense includes the stock option 
expense for the period and the expense related to the performance share units 
(&#147;PSUs&#148;) and deferred share units (&#147;DSUs&#148;).</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the three and six months ended June&nbsp;30, 
2015, the Company recognized $891 and $1,800, respectively (same periods in 
2014, $594 and $1,121) of share based payment expense related to PSUs 
</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-
align:center;">11<a name="PB_11_152401_3020"></a></p>
<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade 
align="left" style="color:#010101;"></div>
</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='11',FILE='C:\JMS\105568\15-16617-1\task7517244\16617-1-mo-
07.htm',USER='105568',CD='Jul 31 02:49 2015' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-
align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">LAKE SHORE GOLD CORP</font></b>.</p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">NOTES
TO THE CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED INTERIM FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</font></b></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">FOR 
THE THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2015 AND 2014</font></b></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><i><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">(in 
thousands of Canadian dollars, except&#160; for share information and per share 
amounts, unaudited)</font></i></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"
style="font-size:10.0pt;">and DSUs. Share based liabilities at June&nbsp;30, 
2015 and December&nbsp;31, 2014 were $3,503 and $2,088, respectively ($1,820 and
$394 current share based liability, respectively at June&nbsp;30, 2015 and 
December&nbsp;31, 2014).</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">Share based payment expense recognized for the period 
is allocated to production costs (expense related to stock options granted to 
mine employees) and general and administrative costs (expense related to PSUs, 
DSUs and stock options granted to directors and corporate employees).</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">The allocation of the share based payment expense 
(including stock options related expense and PSUs and DSUs expense) in the 
condensed consolidated statements of comprehensive income for the three and six 
month periods ended June&nbsp;30, 2015 and 2014 is as follows:</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New 
Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">c)&#160;&#160; Basic and 
diluted earnings per share</font></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">The basic and diluted earnings per share for the three
and six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2015 and 2014 is calculated as shown in the 
table below. The diluted earnings per share for the three and six months ended 
June&nbsp;30, 2015 and 2014 includes the impact of certain outstanding options; 
the impact of the outstanding convertible debentures is not included in the 
calculations as the impact would be anti-dilutive.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-
align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">LAKE SHORE GOLD CORP</font></b>.</p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">NOTES
TO THE CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED INTERIM FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</font></b></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">FOR 
THE THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2015 AND 2014</font></b></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><i><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">(in 
thousands of Canadian dollars, except for share information and per share 
amounts, unaudited)</font></i></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-
indent:-.25in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">11.</font></b><font size="1" style="font-
size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><b>SUPPLEMENTAL CASH 
FLOW INFORMATION</b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="96%" style="border-
collapse:collapse;margin-left:.25in;">
<tr>
<td width="51%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:51.38%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>    </td>
<td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.58%;">
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font 
size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-
weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>    </td>
<td width="21%" colspan="5" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-
bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:21.2%;">

size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-

style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-
indent:-.25in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">12.</font></b><font size="1" style="font-
size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><b>SEGMENTED 
INFORMATION</b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company has two operating segments: mining 
operations and exploration and advanced exploration. Corporate, which is not an 
operating segment, includes all the corporate growth and development activities 
and the corporate team that provides administrative, technical, financial and 
other support to all of the Company&#146;s business units. Other corporate 
expenses include general and administrative costs and the Company&#146;s share 
of loss of its equity investments, finance (loss) income, net, bank and debt 
interest and other charges and interest earned on cash and cash equivalents. The
information reported below is based on the information provided to the Chief 
Executive Officer, who is the chief operating decision maker.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-
align:center;">13<a name="PB_13_151201_2668"></a></p>
<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade 
align="left" style="color:#010101;"></div>

<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-
align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">LAKE SHORE GOLD CORP</font></b>.</p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">NOTES
TO THE CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED INTERIM FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</font></b></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">FOR 
THE THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2015 AND 2014</font></b></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><i><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">(in 
thousands of Canadian dollars, except for share information and per share 
amounts, unaudited)</font></i></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New 
Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">As at and 
for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2015</font></i></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

collapse:collapse;margin-left:.25in;">

<td width="41%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:41.56%;">

size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-

size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-

<td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.58%;">

face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">147,626</font></p>    </td>
<td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.04%;">

style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>    </td>   </tr>  </table>

style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

align="left" style="color:black;"></div>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">* Mining operations include activities on the 
Company&#146;s Timmins West Mine, Bell Creek Mine and Bell Creek 
Mill.</font></p>

size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-
align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">LAKE SHORE GOLD CORP</font></b>.</p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">NOTES
TO THE CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED INTERIM FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</font></b></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">FOR 
THE THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2015 AND 2014</font></b></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><i><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">(in 
thousands of Canadian dollars, except for share information and per share 
amounts, unaudited)</font></i></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">** Exploration and advanced exploration include green 
field exploration (which is expensed on the consolidated statement of 
comprehensive income) as well as properties capitalized as per the 
Company&#146;s policy (other than expenditures on properties forming part of 
mining operations).</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company sells its gold bullion through several 
brokers and there is no economic dependence; the Company does not have any long 
term sales contracts.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-
indent:-.25in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">13.</font></b><font size="1" style="font-
size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><b>FINANCIAL 
INSTRUMENTS</b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New 
Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">CARRYING VALUES OF FINANCIAL
INSTRUMENTS</font></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">The carrying values of the financial assets and 
liabilities at June&nbsp;30, 2015 and December&nbsp;31, 2014 are as 
follows:</font></p>

style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New 
Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">FAIR VALUES OF FINANCIAL 
INSTRUMENTS</font></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">The fair values of cash and cash equivalents, 
restricted cash, receivables and accounts payable and accrued liabilities
approximate their carrying values due to the short term to maturity of these 
financial instruments. The fair value of Debentures at June&nbsp;30, 2015 is 
$116,934 (December&nbsp;31, 2014 - $97,021).</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-
align:center;">16<a name="PB_16_153736_5796"></a></p>
<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade

amounts, unaudited)</font></i></p>

style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 
2.25pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.82%;">
<p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2"
face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2,088</font></p>    </td>
<td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" 
style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.02%;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>    </td>   </tr>  </table>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company does not have any financial instruments 
measured using Level 3 inputs. The Company does not offset financial assets with
financial liabilities and there were no transfers between Level 1 and Level 2 
input financial instruments.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">The fair value of the gold loan liability and embedded
derivative asset are determined by discounting future payments based on forward 
gold prices and forward US$/Canadian$ foreign exchange rates.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">The fair value of share based liabilities is 
determined based on option pricing models that utilize a variety of inputs that 
are a combination of quoted prices and market corroborated inputs.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New 
Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">14 SUBSEQUENT 
EVENTS</font></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">On July&nbsp;16, 2015, the Company submitted a binding
proposal to Temex Resources Corp. (&#147;Temex&#148;) for the acquisition of all
of the common shares of Temex. Under the terms of the proposal, Temex 
shareholders would receive, for each Temex share, 0.105 of a Lake Shore Gold 
share (approximately 19 million shares of the Company valued at $23,000 at 
July&nbsp;15, 2015).</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">The proposal by the Company follows the announcement 
in June&nbsp;that Temex had entered into an agreement with Oban Mining 
Corporation (&#147;Oban&#148;) in respect of its proposed acquisition of all 
common shares of each of Eagle Hill Exploration Corporation, Ryan Gold Corp., 
Corona Gold Corporation and Temex (the &#147;Oban Agreement&#148;).</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">Temex has disclosed that its Board of Directors has
determined that the proposed agreement with Lake Shore Gold is a &#147;superior 
proposal&#148; as defined in the Oban Agreement and has provided notice of such 
determination to Oban.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-
align:center;">17<a name="PB_17_154137_2897"></a></p>
<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade 
align="left" style="color:#010101;"></div>
</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='17',FILE='C:\JMS\105590\15-16617-1\task7517292\16617-1-mo-
09.htm',USER='105590',CD='Jul 31 03:16 2015' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-
align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-
size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">LAKE SHORE GOLD CORP</font></b>.</p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">NOTES
TO THE CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED INTERIM FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</font></b></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">FOR 
THE THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2015 AND 2014</font></b></p>
<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><i><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">(in 
thousands of Canadian dollars, except for share information and per share 
amounts, unaudited)</font></i></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">Under the terms of the Oban Agreement, Oban has a 
period of ten business days expiring on July&nbsp;30, 2015 (the &#147;Response 
Period&#148;) to submit an offer to amend the terms of that agreement with 
Temex.&#160; If, within the Response Period, Oban offers to amend the Oban 
Agreement such that the Temex Board determines that the proposed agreement with 
Lake Shore Gold is no longer a superior proposal, Temex will be required to 
enter into an amendment to the Oban Agreement and implement the amended 
agreement. In that circumstance, no agreement will be entered into between Temex
and Lake Shore Gold with respect to the transaction proposed by Lake Shore 
Gold.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">Temex has disclosed that if, within the Response 
Period, Oban does not offer to amend the Oban Agreement, or if the proposed Lake
Shore Gold transaction continues to be superior to an amended transaction 
proposed by Oban, Temex may pay Oban the agreed upon termination payment of 
$691,856, terminate the Oban Agreement, and enter into an agreement with Lake 
Shore Gold to complete a transaction on the terms proposed by Lake Shore Gold. 
In that event, the agreement proposed by the Company would require the directors
and officers of Temex to enter into lock-up agreements with respect to the 
transaction with Lake Shore Gold on substantially the same terms as the 
agreements entered into with Oban and pursuant to which, among other things, 
they would agree to vote their Temex common shares in favour of the Lake Shore 
Gold transaction at a meeting of shareholders of Temex to be called to consider 
such transaction.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-
align:center;">18<a name="PB_18_154202_3020"></a></p>

align="left" style="color:#010101;"></div>

style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">GENERAL</font></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">This Management&#146;s Discussion and Analysis, or 
MD&amp;A, is intended to assist the reader in understanding and assessing the 
trends and significant changes in the results of operations and financial 
condition of Lake Shore Gold Corp. (the &#147;Company&#148; or &#147;Lake Shore 
Gold&#148;). This </font>MD&amp;A should be read in conjunction with the 
unaudited condensed consolidated interim financial statements of the Company, 
including the notes thereto, for the three and six months ended June&nbsp;31, 
2015 and 2014 (the &#147;financial statements&#148;), which are prepared in 
accordance with International Financial Reporting Standards (&#147;IFRS&#148;) 
for interim financial statements, as issued by the International Accounting 
Standards Board, and the annual MD&amp;A for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 
2014. This MD&amp;A has taken into account information available up to and 
including July&nbsp;29, 2015. All dollar amounts are in Canadian dollars unless 
otherwise stated.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">This MD&amp;A contains forward-looking statements. For
example, statements in the &#147;Outlook&#148; section are forward looking, and 
any statements elsewhere with respect to the cost or timeline of planned or 
expected development, production, or exploration are all forward-looking 
statements. As well, statements about future production capacity, growth, 
financial position, capital adequacy and/or the need for future financing are 
also forward-looking statements. All forward-looking statements, including 
forward-looking statements not specifically identified in this paragraph, are 
made subject to the cautionary language at the end of this document, and readers
are directed to refer to that cautionary language when reading any forward-
looking statements.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-
align:center;">1<a name="PB_1_154448_7056"></a></p>
<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade 
align="left" style="color:#010101;"></div>
</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='1',FILE='C:\JMS\108736\15-16617-1\task7516341\16617-1-mq-
01.htm',USER='108736',CD='Jul 30 21:01 2015' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><b><font size="2" 
face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-
weight:bold;">Overview</font></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">Lake Shore Gold operates two underground gold mines 
(Timmins West Mine and Bell Creek Mine) and a central milling facility located 
within the Porcupine Gold Camp in Timmins, Ontario Canada. Gold in dor&#233; 
form is produced at the mill and is shipped for fine refining to a facility in 
Southern Ontario. The finished gold is sold on a regular basis as it becomes 
available.&#160; The Company also has a portfolio of undeveloped deposits and 
highly prospective exploration properties which support both sustainability and
future growth. Revenue from gold sales in the most recent fiscal year (2014) 
totaled $256.1 million from sales of 183,300 ounces (total production of 185,600
gold ounces).</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s Timmins West Complex is located 18 
kilometres west of the City of Timmins and hosts the Timmins West Mine, an 
underground mining operation that produced 142,200 ounces of gold in 2014.&#160;
Production at the Timmins West Mine comes from two deposits, Timmins Deposit and
Thunder Creek Deposit, both of which are open for expansion. Additional growth 
opportunities at Timmins West Complex include the 144 Trend and the Gold River 
Trend Deposit. The 144 Trend is a four kilometre structural corridor which 
trends in a southwesterly direction commencing approximately 500 metres from the
Timmins West Mine. The discovery of two significant zones of gold mineralization
since October&nbsp;2014 (the 144 Gap and 144 Gap SW zones) illustrates the 
potential for additional gold deposits along the 144 Trend. The Gold River Trend
(&#147;GRT&#148;) is a six kilometre long structural corridor, which has an 
east-west strike and is located 3 kilometres south of the Timmins West Mine. The
Gold River Trend Deposit is hosted within the GRT and currently hosts over a 
million ounces of inferred resources with growth potential.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On the east side of the City of Timmins, 
the Bell Creek Complex hosts the Company&#146;s milling facility as well as the 
Bell Creek Mine. </font>The Bell Creek Mine is an underground mine that produced
43,400 ounces in 2014 from mining within the Labine Deposit. The Labine Deposit 
is currently being mined to the 820 metre level, with reserves outlined to the 
1165 Level. There remains a large resource identified below the current reserve 
in the Labine Deposit to a depth of approximately 1600 metres, providing 
additional opportunities for growth. The Bell Creek Complex also hosts two 
additional deposits, Vogel and Marlhill, as well as other exploration 
targets.</p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s central mill, located at
the Bell Creek Complex, is a </font>conventional gold milling circuit, which 
processes ore from both the Timmins West and Bell Creek mines. In 2014, the mill
processed over 1.2 million tonnes with average recoveries of 96.6%.</p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">A third gold complex, the Fenn-Gib Deposit, is located
approximately 60 kilometres east of Bell Creek. Fenn-Gib is an advanced-stage 
exploration project, which hosts a large, near-surface deposit with excellent 
potential for further growth.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">Lake Shore Gold is a reporting issuer in all Provinces
in Canada (excluding the Territories), and a foreign private issuer in the 
United States. The Company&#146;s common shares trade on the Toronto Stock 
Exchange and NYSE MKT under the symbol LSG.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><b><font size="2" 
face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-
weight:bold;">Strategy</font></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">Lake Shore Gold&#146;s strategy to become an
intermediate gold producer is to mine existing reserves, establish new reserves 
and resources at its current operations, and explore, discover and</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-
align:center;">2<a name="PB_2_154508_5335"></a></p>
<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade 
align="left" style="color:#010101;"></div>
</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='2',FILE='C:\JMS\108736\15-16617-1\task7516341\16617-1-mq-
01.htm',USER='108736',CD='Jul 30 21:01 2015' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">selectively acquire new deposits, leading to 
additional growth in reserves, resources and production.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">A key strategic priority for the Company is sustaining
and growing its mining business by maintaining safe and responsible operations, 
being an efficient, low-cost gold producer, generating positive free cash flow 
and continually investing to explore and develop additional deposits and new 
discoveries on the Company&#146;s existing properties.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times 
New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Increasing shareholder value is the main 
objective of the strategy, and includes </font>consistently meeting and 
exceeding the Company&#146;s key performance targets. Strong operating 
performance is a key driver of free cash flow, which in turn funds the work 
required to continually replace reserves and to build resources in support of 
production growth, long-life operation and long-term value creation.</p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">HIGHLIGHTS</font></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">Lake Shore Gold achieved strong operating and 
financial results in the first six months of 2015 (&#147;H1/15&#148;), including
record half-year performances in gold sales, average unit costs, revenue, cash 
earnings from mine operations, earnings from mine operations and cash flows from
operating activities. Growth in cash flows from operating activities compared to
the first half of 2014 (&#147;H1/14&#148;) was achieved at the same time that 
the Company increased exploration expenditures by $11.5 million mainly related 
to its ongoing drilling program at the 144 Trend, where two new gold zones have 
been discovered since the drill program commenced in August&nbsp;2014. Finance 
expenses in H1/15 declined $3.4 million or 34% compared to H1/14 reflecting 
lower debt levels. On May&nbsp;29, 2015 the Company completed the repayment of 
its senior, secured debt with the final payment on its gold-linked 
note.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><b><font size="2" 
face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-
weight:bold;">Performance</font></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;punctuation-
wrap:simple;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-
size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&
#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Produced 95,600 ounces of gold in 
H1/15, 42,600 ounces of gold in Q2/15</p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;punctuation-
wrap:simple;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-

#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Poured 96,400 ounces in H1/15, 44,400
ounces in Q2/15</p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;punctuation-
wrap:simple;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-

ounces in Q2/15</p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;punctuation-

per ounce sold<font size="1" style="font-size:6.5pt;position:relative;top:-
3.0pt;">(1)</font>&nbsp;of US$551 (based on production costs of $67.2 million) 
in H1/15, US$597 (based on production costs of $33.8 million) in Q2/15</p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;punctuation-

3.0pt;">(2)</font>&nbsp;of US$809 per ounce sold in H1/15, US$877 per ounce in 
Q2/15</p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;punctuation-wrap:simple;"><b><font 
size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Cash 
Flow and Profitability</font></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;punctuation-

2015)</p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;punctuation-

#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Completed $12.0 million of drilling 
and other exploration work in H1/15, mainly at the 144 Trend, $6.8 million in 
Q2/15</p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;punctuation-
wrap:simple;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-

#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Repaid $7.2 million of gold-linked 
note in H1/15 ($2.9 million in Q2/15); senior secured debt fully repaid as of 
May&nbsp;29, 2015</p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;punctuation-
wrap:simple;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-
size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&
#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Achieved cash earnings from mine 
operations<font size="1" style="font-size:6.5pt;position:relative;top:-
3.0pt;">(3)</font>&nbsp;of $79.6 million and earnings from mine operations of 
$37.6 million in H1/15, $33.7 million and $14.2 million, respectively, in 
Q2/15</p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" 
style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;punctuation-
wrap:simple;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-
size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-
